nsp.impl.random

Class RandomGenerator_Kernel

  • java.lang.Object
    • nsp.impl.random.RandomGenerator_Kernel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, RandomGenerator

    public class RandomGenerator_Kernel
extends java.lang.Object
implements RandomGenerator, java.lang.Cloneable
    Number generator that implements the RandomGenerator interface, and returns pseudo-random numbers drawn from an empirical distribution. This class is primarily a wrapper for the Colt package's Empirical class.

      • getNext

        public java.lang.Number getNext()
        Returns the next pseudo-random value from the generator. If the rotate parameter is true, then the random number is rotated such that the midpoint of the first bin will fall at zero. e.g. If there are eight bins, and the random number falls in the first bin, .0625 is subtracted from the number. A modulus of 1 is then applied so that values will remain in the interval zero to 1. This way, the values can be post-multiplied by tau=2*pi to get an angle.
        Specified by:
        getNext in interface RandomGenerator

      • setRotate

        public void setRotate(boolean rotate)
        Sets whether probability values should be rotated so that the midpoint of the first bin falls on zero.
        Parameters:
        rotate - - indicates whether probability values should be rotated.

      • setWeights

        public void setWeights(double[] weights)
        Sets the weights (and number) of the bins
        Parameters:
        weights - - the pdf to be used to weight the bins
